articles.title: 'I Imagined Returning to my Country as World Champion': Lionel Messi Pens Message of Gratitude After Hero's Homecoming Against Panama
articles.description: Following Argentina's friendly win over Panama in Buenos Aires, Messi took to the social media platform Instagram to express his gratitude to the fans who serenaded the team and their captain, who celebrated lifting the World Cup after a wait of 36 years at the Monumental
articles.content:
FIFA World Cup winner Lionel Messi received a warm reception from his adoring fans in Argentina as the Albiceleste played their first game on home soil following their Qatar heroics.
The seven-time Balon d’Or winner led the Argentine side to a 2-0 wi... [1972 chars]

articles.title: Fired Marvel Exec Victoria Alonso Says Disney ‘Silenced’ Her
articles.description: An attorney for Victoria Alonso, who was fired as head of Marvel’s VFX and post-production, said the exec was “silenced” by Disney.” Disney called the claims “unfortunate.” Previous reports suggested ‘Argentina, 1985’ was a factor in her termination.
articles.content:
Photo: Jesse Grant/Getty Images for Disney
After being fired from her longtime role as Marvel’s VFX and postproduction president, Victoria Alonso is ready to fire back against claims about why she lost her job. Patty Glaser, Alonso’s attorney, issued... [2319 chars]

articles.title: Miami Open: Carlos Alcaraz, Taylor Fritz, Jannik Sinner All Breeze Into Third Round
articles.description: Defending champion Alcaraz defeated Argentina's Facundo Bagnis 6-0, 6-2 as the Spaniard got his title defence off to a smooth start. American Fritz saw off 21-year-old Californian Emilio Nava 6-4, 6-1, while Sinner registered a 6-4, 6-2 victory against Laslo Djere
articles.content:
World number one Carlos Alcaraz made an emphatic start to his Miami Open title defence, defeating Argentina’s Facundo Bagnis 6-0, 6-2 on Friday.
The 19-year-old Spaniard, the youngest ever player to top the rankings, is looking to complete the “Sunsh... [3442 chars]

articles.title: Where to eat, drink and sleep on your next trip to Argentina
articles.description: After one of the world's longest lockdowns, the nation's culinary creativity has bubbled over with exciting restaurants and incredible bars around every corner.
articles.content:
The fuzzy sound of music through an old speaker provides the soundtrack at bar Varela Varelita, the perfect place in Buenos Aires to while away a lazy afternoon.

articles.title: I got plastic surgery so my kids would inherit my new nose
articles.description: A TikTok user from Argentina has gone viral for joking that the results of her "nose job" would be passed down to future offspring – prompting backlash from viewers who couldn't sniff out the satire.
articles.content:
She sure has a nosey audience.
A woman from Argentina has gone viral for joking that the results of her “nose job” would be passed down to future offspring — prompting backlash from viewers who couldn’t sniff out the satire.

articles.title: Canada's Andreescu, Shapovalov advance to 3rd round of Miami Open
articles.description: Canada's Denis Shapovalov has advanced to the third round of the Miami Open tennis tournament with a 6-3, 3-6, 6-3 win over Argentina's Guido Pella.
articles.content:
Canadians Bianca Andreescu and Denis Shapovalov have advanced to the third round of the Miami Open tennis tournament.
Andreescu, from Mississauga, Ont., moved on in the women's draw with a 5-7, 6-3, 6-4 win over seventh seed Maria Sakkari of Greece i... [2686 chars]

articles.title: A Locals’ Guide to Buenos Aires: The Buzzy Bars, Grills and Chic Shops That Insiders Love
articles.description: After Argentina’s World Cup win, the city is in a state of prolonged elation and we’ve found four notable residents, including soccer star Nicolás Tagliafico, to recommend their favorite spots
articles.content: FOUNDED IN 1536 by Spanish explorers, Buenos Aires has been called the “Paris of South America.” Sprawling and sophisticated, it has cobbled streets, chic cafes, abundant plazas and colonial architecture (Spanish, French and Italian) that lend it a E... [587 chars]
